title: Same-Category Neighbor Ratio as Confidence Feature
findings:
Same-category neighbor ratio (SCNR) measures what fraction of a disease's k=20 nearest neighbors
are from the same disease category.

FINDINGS:
- Correlation with hit rate: -0.019 (weak positive)
- Correlation with existing confidence: -0.186 (weak positive)

IMPACT:
- Baseline (combined_avg >= 0.6): n=163, precision=83.1%
- With SCNR >= 0.1 filter: n=128, precision=82.8%
- Improvement: -0.3%

VERDICT: SCNR provides marginal additional signal

Note: The low same-category ratios (often <10%) suggest that disease embeddings
are organized more by functional similarity than by disease category.
This explains why category-based confidence (h71) is more predictive than
adding SCNR as a feature.
